results.title: Elizabeth
results.creator_credit: PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Working Title Films, Channel Four Films, Alexandra Byrne, John Myhre, Michael Hirst, Shekhar Kapur, Alison Owen, Eric Fellner and Tim Bevan
results.brief_description: The story of the ascension to the throne and the early reign of Queen Elizabeth the First, the endless attempts by her council to marry her off, the Catholic hatred of her and her romance with Lord Robert Dudley.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.name: Jill Bilcock
constellations_other.description: An editor’s work often goes unnoticed, but they’re scene-stitching not only brings the director’s vision to life but sometimes steals the show. One of Australia’s greatest editors, Jill Bilcock, has shaped some of the country’s most memorable screen stories.

results.creator_credit_for_label: PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Working Title Films, Channel Four Films, Alexandra Byrne, John Myhre, Michael Hirst, Shekhar Kapur, Alison Owen, Eric Fellner and Tim Bevan

results.title: Eat Drink Man Woman
results.headline_credit: Taiwan and United States of America, 1994
results.brief_description: The film tells the story of a retired and widowed Chinese master chef Chu (Si Hung Lung) and his family living in modern day Taipei, Taiwan.

constellations_other.name: Culture, food and family
constellations_other.description: Food as a link to culture and family.

results.description: The film tells the story of a retired and widowed Chinese master chef Chu (Si Hung Lung) and his family living in modern day Taipei, Taiwan. At the start of the film, he lives with his three attractive daughters, all of whom are unattached. As the film progresses, each of the daughters encounters new men in their lives. When these new relationships blossom, the stereotypes are broken and the living situation within the family changes.. The film features several scenes displaying the techniques and artistry of gourmet Chinese cooking. Since the family members have difficulty expressing their love for each other, the intricate preparation of banquet quality dishes for their Sunday dinners is the surrogate for their familial feelings.
description_for_label: The film tells the story of a retired and widowed Chinese master chef Chu (Si Hung Lung) and his family living in modern day Taipei, Taiwan. At the start of the film, he lives with his three attractive daughters, all of whom are unattached. As the film progresses, each of the daughters encounters new men in their lives. When these new relationships blossom, the stereotypes are broken and the living situation within the family changes.. The film features several scenes displaying the techniques and artistry of gourmet Chinese cooking. Since the family members have difficulty expressing their love for each other, the intricate preparation of banquet quality dishes for their Sunday dinners is the surrogate for their familial feelings.

results.title: East West 101
results.brief_description: Zane Malik and the Major Crime Squad investigate crime and murder in all quarters of multicultural Sydney.

constellations_other.name: 2000s TV
constellations_other.description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

results.description: Zane Malik and the Major Crime Squad investigate crime and murder in all quarters of multicultural Sydney.
description_for_label: Zane Malik and the Major Crime Squad investigate crime and murder in all quarters of multicultural Sydney.

results.title: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Amblin Entertainment, Steven Spielberg, Kathleen Kennedy, Melissa Mathison, James D. Bissell, Al Bailey and Carlo Rambaldi
results.brief_description: After a gentle alien becomes stranded on Earth, the being is discovered and befriended by a young boy named Elliott. Bringing the extraterrestrial into his suburban California house, Elliott introduces E.T., as the alien is dubbed, to his brother and his little sister, Gertie, and the children decide to keep its existence a secret. Soon, however, E.T. falls ill, resulting in government intervention and a dire situation for both Elliott and the alien.

constellations_other.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_other.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Universal Pictures, Amblin Entertainment, Steven Spielberg, Kathleen Kennedy, Melissa Mathison, James D. Bissell, Al Bailey and Carlo Rambaldi
results.description: After a gentle alien becomes stranded on Earth, the being is discovered and befriended by a young boy named Elliott. Soon, however, E.T. falls ill, resulting in government intervention and a dire situation for both Elliott and the alien.

results.title: Duck Soup
results.brief_description: Rufus T. Firefly is named president/dictator of bankrupt Freedonia and declares war on neighboring Sylvania over the love of wealthy Mrs. Teasdale.

constellations_other.name: Reflecting duality and revealing new realities
constellations_other.description: The Toupie Fantoche relies on four prismatic mirrors to reflect changes in animation states.

results.description: Rufus T. Firefly is named president/dictator of bankrupt Freedonia and declares war on neighboring Sylvania over the love of wealthy Mrs. Teasdale.

results.title: Drive
results.creator_credit: FilmDistrict, Bold Films, Marc Platt Productions, OddLot Entertainment, Motel Movies, Newbridge Film Capital, Nicolas Winding Refn, Gigi Pritzker, Adam Siegel, Hossein Amini, Beth Mickle, Michel Litvak, Erin Benach, John Palermo and Marc Platt
results.brief_description: Driver is a skilled Hollywood stuntman who moonlights as a getaway driver for criminals. Though he projects an icy exterior, lately he’s been warming up to a pretty neighbor named Irene and her young son, Benicio.

constellations_other.name: Electric Sound Supercut: composers and their distinctive other worlds
constellations_other.description: Electric sound is commonly associated with science fiction narratives for its auditory oddness, which has symbolised other worldly environments, the unconscious and the 1980s.

results.creator_credit_for_label: FilmDistrict, Bold Films, Marc Platt Productions, OddLot Entertainment, Motel Movies, Newbridge Film Capital, Nicolas Winding Refn, Gigi Pritzker, Adam Siegel, Hossein Amini, Beth Mickle, Michel Litvak, Erin Benach, John Palermo and Marc Platt
results.description: Driver is a skilled Hollywood stuntman who moonlights as a getaway driver for criminals. Though he projects an icy exterior, lately he’s been warming up to a pretty neighbor named Irene and her young son, Benicio. When Irene’s husband gets out of jail, he enlists Driver’s help in a million-dollar heist. The job goes horribly wrong, and Driver must risk his life to protect Irene and Benicio from the vengeful masterminds behind the robbery.

results.title: Dreams
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros. Pictures, Akira Kurosawa USA, Akira Kurosawa, Mike Y. Inoue, Hisao Kurosawa, Ishirō Honda, Yoshirô Muraki, Akira Sakuragi, Seikichi Iizumi and Mark Sullivan
results.headline_credit: Japan and United States of America, 1990
results.brief_description: A collection of magical tales based upon the actual dreams of director Akira Kurosawa.

constellations_other.name: Painting pictures
constellations_other.description: Painter and photographer Louis Le Prince was inspired to develop the technology to make animated pictures by the circular panoramic paintings of his friends. His films captured everyday life and alluded to his artistic vision for cinema.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Warner Bros. Pictures, Akira Kurosawa USA, Akira Kurosawa, Mike Y. Inoue, Hisao Kurosawa, Ishirō Honda, Yoshirô Muraki, Akira Sakuragi, Seikichi Iizumi and Mark Sullivan
results.description: A collection of magical tales based upon the actual dreams of director Akira Kurosawa.
description_for_label: A collection of magical tales based upon the actual dreams of director Akira Kurosawa.

results.title: Dreamgirls
results.brief_description: Three young women dream of becoming pop stars—and get their wish when they’re chosen to be backup singers for the legendary James ‘Thunder’ Early.
results.description: Three young women dream of becoming pop stars—and get their wish when they’re chosen to be backup singers for the legendary James ‘Thunder’ Early.

results.title: Dracula: Pages from a Virgin's Diary
results.creator_credit: CBC, Paul Daigle and Deanne Rohde
results.brief_description: A cinematic version of the Royal Winnipeg Ballet’s adaptation of Bram Stoker’s Gothic novel Dracula, filmed in a style reminiscent of silent Expressionist cinema of the early 20th century, complete with inter-titles and monochrome photography.

constellations_other.name: Using the silent film aesthetic
constellations_other.description: Explore how contemporary filmmakers use visual references to the silent era to convey information to a film literate audience.

results.description: A cinematic version of the Royal Winnipeg Ballet’s adaptation of Bram Stoker’s gothic novel Dracula. Filmed in a style reminiscent of silent Expressionist cinema of the early 20th century (complete with intertitles and monochrome photography), it uses dance to tell the story of a sinister but intriguing immigrant who preys upon young English women.
description_for_label: A cinematic version of the Royal Winnipeg Ballet’s adaptation of Bram Stoker’s gothic novel Dracula. Filmed in a style reminiscent of silent Expressionist cinema of the early 20th century (complete with intertitles and monochrome photography), it uses dance to tell the story of a sinister but intriguing immigrant who preys upon young English women.

results.title: Dracula
results.creator_credit: The Mirisch Company, Universal Pictures, Julie Harris, Peter Murton, Walter Mirisch and W.D. Richter
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1979
results.brief_description: A seductive and elegant screen adaptation of the stage version of Bram Stoker’s immortal classic Dracula, penned by Hamilton Dean and John L. Balderston.
results.creator_credit_for_label: The Mirisch Company, Universal Pictures, Julie Harris, Peter Murton, Walter Mirisch and W.D. Richter
results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1979
results.description: Romanticized adaptation of Bram Stoker’s 1897 classic. Count Dracula is a subject of fatal attraction to more than one English maiden lady, as he seeks an immortal bride.
description_for_label: Romanticized adaptation of Bram Stoker’s 1897 classic. Count Dracula is a subject of fatal attraction to more than one English maiden lady, as he seeks an immortal bride.
